intro: Rosa communis var. malmundariensis, commonly known as the Malmundariensis rose, is a botanical variant of the common rose. It is characterized by its fragrant, semi-double to double pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with thorny stems and dark green, serrated leaves. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant blooms and pleasant scent.
